item.title: Covid: Eight Indian variant areas should avoid indoor gatherings
item.description: People are also asked not to go into or out of places hardest hit by the so-called Indian variant.

item.title: EU agrees new Belarus sanctions after plane arrest
item.description: Belarusian airlines will be banned from EU skies after a flight was diverted and a journalist held.

item.title: PM's burka comments gave impression of insensitivity - report
item.description: Boris Johnson launched a report in 2019 following complaints of Islamophobia in the party.

item.title: BBC to publish report on Bashir rehiring next week
item.description: The director general says there is "no doubt" recruiting Martin Bashir in 2016 was a "big mistake".

item.title: Sasha Johnson: Black Lives Matter activist shot by group of men
item.description: The Met Police says there was "nothing to suggest" that Sasha Johnson had been "targeted".

item.title: Israel-Gaza conflict: Blinken promises US support for Gaza reconstruction
item.description: The US secretary of state wants to consolidate a ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants.

item.title: Emma Faulds murder: Former prison officer Ross Willox found guilty
item.description: Ross Willox killed Emma Faulds in his South Ayrshire home then dumped her naked body in the Galloway Forest.

item.title: Former Royal Marine makes a stand against anti-social behaviour
item.description: Sean Ivey fought back at youths plaguing his village but then saw his home burnt down.

item.title: Conservative MP Rob Roberts told staffer to be 'less alluring'
item.description: Tory MP faces six-week suspension from Parliament after panel found he sexually harassed an employee.

item.title: Rocco Morabito: Italian fugitive arrested in Brazil
item.description: Rocco Morabito, who has been wanted since the 1990s, escaped from a prison in Uruguay in 2019.

item.title: Texas to allow unlicensed carrying of handguns
item.description: A bill which further eases some of the loosest gun laws in the US is set to be approved.

item.title: England name provisional Euro 2020 squad: Ben White, Ben Godfrey, Aaron Ramsdale and Sam Johnstone in
item.description: Uncapped Ben White, Ben Godfrey, Sam Johnstone and Aaron Ramsdale are named in England's 33-man provisional Euro 2020 squad.

item.title: In pictures: Prince William visits Scotland
item.description: The Earl of Strathearn has taken part in a range of events during his trip.

item.title: The Papers: Brits flock to Spain as EU leaders condemn Belarus
item.description: Tuesday's front pages look back at Covid deaths in hospitals and ahead to further lockdown easing.

item.title: Mouse plague deals fresh blow to Australian farmers
item.description: After drought, fires and floods, Australia is now in the grip of a devastating mouse plague.

item.title: DR Congo's Goma volcano: Desperate search for children missing after eruption
item.description: Families were separated as people fled the lava after Saturday night's eruption of Mount Nyiragongo.

item.title: Exams 2021: How will my grades be assessed this year?
item.description: Exams have been cancelled for the second year running due to the impact caused by coronavirus.

item.title: Covid: Deaf campaigner calls for clear mask research
item.description: A campaigner is calling for more research into clear masks to stop people feeling isolated.

item.title: Street's power turned off for dramatic cat rescue
item.description: The mischievous moggy spent hours stuck at the top of a 10m electricity pole in Stow-on-the-Wold.

item.title: George Floyd death: How do I talk to my son about race?
item.description: A year on from the death of George Floyd, BBC presenter Eddie Nestor examines his role as a father.

item.title: Trafalgar Square Fourth Plinth: Shortlist announced
item.description: The Fourth Plinth in Trafalgar Square is home to a rolling commission of artworks.

item.title: 'I had my political career taken away from me'
item.description: Four years on from Parliament's bullying and harassment scandal - how much has really changed?

item.title: Tech giants fight 'cloud wars' deep in the ocean
item.description: To boost their services, Google and Facebook are investing in undersea cables that span the world.

item.title: Belarus plane: What happens with a military jet interception?
item.description: Simon Browning looks at standard aviation protocols after a "major diplomatic incident" on Sunday.

item.title: Covid: How the pandemic is affecting your dreams
item.description: More than year into Covid-19, do people in your dreams wear masks or socially distance?

item.title: Hinkley C: Hundreds more needed to finish nuclear power station
item.description: The new jobs will include roles in construction, welding and electrical installation roles.

item.title: Who could represent the UK at the Eurovision Song Contest 2022?
item.description: Could Bill Bailey, some drag queens, a rock band, a bhangra act or Ed Sheeran restore some pride?

item.title: Max Mosley: A dizzying intellect; an intimidating man
item.description: Max Mosley was one of the most influential and important figures in motorsport - and also among the most controversial.

item.title: Belarus Ryanair flight diverted: Passengers describe panic on board
item.description: The plane changed course as it neared its destination leaving passengers shocked and confused.

item.title: Wolves close in on ex-Benfica boss Lage as next manager
item.description: Wolves close in on the appointment of Bruno Lage to succeed Nuno Espirito Santo as manager.

item.title: Bruno Fernandes: Man Utd midfielder 'honoured' by Eric Cantona comparison
item.description: Bruno Fernandes speaks to BBC Sport as he prepares for Manchester United's Europa League final against Villarreal on Wednesday.

item.title: Lawrence Okoye on NFL and return to discus: 'Physically I am superior now - American football aided me'
item.description: After nine years, seven American football teams and a lockdown spent throwing in a Hull park, London 2012 poster boy Lawrence Okoye is back in the circle and aiming for the world's elite.

item.title: Can Osaka deliver on clay & grass to complete Grand Slam set?
item.description: Can Naomi Osaka win the French Open? BBC tennis correspondent Russell Fuller asks her that question and more.

item.title: Watch: George Floyd one year on - how sport took a stand against racism
item.description: One year on from the murder of George Floyd, BBC Sport looks back at how the sporting world has taken a stand against racism in the past 12 months.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People in their 20s and 30s are now being offered a Covid vaccine as the UK rollout continues.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Covid Indian variant: Where is it, how does it spread and is it more infectious?
item.description: The Indian variant is spreading in some parts of the country - how serious is it?

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Foreign holidays are now possible, but travellers must follow strict rules on their return.

item.title: What are the rules for weddings and can I hold a reception?
item.description: Restrictions on weddings have been eased across the UK - so how can you now celebrate?

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate and for how long?
item.description: The length of quarantine has changed for contacts and people arriving from abroad.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: People are being told to avoid travelling to eight areas of England where Covid is spreading fast.

item.title: Athlete and father - the man behind the mural
item.description: He was an athlete, friend and father whose life and struggles were emblematic of any American.

item.title: Why was the trial so important?
item.description: Video footage of a US police officer killing an unarmed black man sparked global protests last year.

item.title: George Floyd death: How US police are trying to win back trust
item.description: A year after George Floyd's death, it's not just civilians who'll be reflecting on what happened.

item.title: Black Britons discuss impact of Floyd
item.description: The BBC's Adina Campbell speaks to people in Coventry about the legacy of George Floyd's death.

item.title: George Floyd: The wave of protest songs sparked by his death
item.description: Lyrics of "rage and mourning" were written in the weeks following the African-American's murder.

item.title: Children tell of neglect, filth and fear in US asylum camps
item.description: The BBC has uncovered allegations of cold temperatures, sickness, lice and abuse, through a series of interviews with children and staff at US detention camps for children.

item.title: Martin Bashir inquiry: Diana, the reporter and the BBC
item.description: The full story of how the BBC's Martin Bashir got his 1995 interview with Princess Diana - and what happened next.

item.title: The black children wrongly sent to 'special' schools in the 1970s
item.description: In the '60s and '70s, black children were wrongly sent to schools for the "educationally subnormal".

item.title: Uyghur imams targeted in China's Xinjiang crackdown
item.description: China has targeted Muslim religious leaders, according to a new report, charging many with extremism.

item.title: 'Talk to me': A train driver asking men to open up
item.description: A tragedy inspired Scotland's only woman freight train driver to get men talking about mental health.
